title: Look Around
focus: Cultivating relationships, boundaries, and networks that sustain holistic ministry.
description: Explore your support structures—mentors, peers, education, and boundaries—that uphold your ministry journey.

reflectionQuestions.prompt: Who guides you spiritually and emotionally—mentors, spiritual directors, accountability partners—and how often do you connect?
How do peer relationships and community groups encourage your health in body, mind, and spirit?
What continuing education opportunities nurture your intellect, skills, and spiritual depth?
How do you establish and maintain healthy boundaries around work hours, screen time, and rest?
In what ways do family and personal relationships support or strain your emotional capacity?

tasks.description: Schedule regular check-ins with a mentor or spiritual director for debriefing and prayer.
Attend a workshop, conference, or course that feeds your mind and spirit.
Draft a personal boundary agreement (work hours, digital sabbath) and share it with accountability partners.
Plan a restorative gathering with family or friends that honors rest and relational health.

followUpPrompts.prompt: Which relationship or structure most upheld your body, mind, and spirit?
What boundary adjustments made space for holistic well-being?
How will you expand or deepen this network to prevent isolation and burnout?
